bug.author: jonasrauber
bug.summary: API Documentation with Links to Source Code
bug.description: I think it would be a really great improvement if the API documentation <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/</denchmark-link> would contain links to the corresponding source code file on GitHub, similar to python package documentations on readthedocs.org, e.g. <denchmark-link:https://lasagne.readthedocs.io/en/latest/modules/layers/base.html>https://lasagne.readthedocs.io/en/latest/modules/layers/base.html</denchmark-link> . This would also make it much faster to create pull requests that fix errors in the documentation.

comments.comment:
This is actually happening in the new docs. All the way on the bottom, e.g.: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/DType>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/DType</denchmark-link>
Doesn't work for all things, but close.

Oh wow, sorry for that! I guess I was looking for it in the wrong place... That's really nice, but sometimes it's not clickable, e.g.: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/minimum>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/minimum</denchmark-link>
We're planning to move up the include line to the top of the file soon so it's more visible. Not sure what to do about the generated ops though.
We have a plan for the generated ops, which involves rejigging our build to place generated files into a predictable location. But it's a little bit away.
